instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1466: What is A1466? A1466 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Air from years Early 2015, 2017, Mid 2012, Mid 2013, Early 2014 with EMC 2925, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00165, 820-3209, 820-3437..

threads.title: Macbook AIR 2013 <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> FUCK!
threads.message: So i spent half a day fixing this board and boom fan spin cpu heating up!!! YAY!!!!! !!! Reassemble no video... tryed a new lcd and boom perfect video... My question here is how do i tell this lovely amazing customer that she needs a new 250$ LCD and board repair...?$300 my rate.. ?

threads.title: Macbook AIR 2013 <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> FUCK!
threads.message: Why not check if it is just the LCD cable? I'd say it's a write off with LCD and board. If she does not want to pay swap the board with a parts board.

threads.title: Macbook AIR 2013 <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> FUCK!
threads.message: Sounds good duke.. Was not aware you could swap the sables on these without destroying the lcd?

threads.title: Macbook AIR 2013 <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> FUCK!
threads.message: It depends on how careful you are when removing the screen bezel. ;)

threads.title: Macbook AIR 2013 <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> FUCK!
threads.message: If there is no visible damage to the connector chances will be small though.
